comments:
I2000410190941

We had a listener that asked for the active editor using getActiveEditor(). This
listener was triggered while the editor was restored and resulted in an NPE. We
had to change the code to ask for the active part.

Test Case:
0. prepare a workspace with 2 open Java editors. Close it.
1. in JavaReconciler.isActiveEditor() rev. 1.19 add
     return page.getActiveEditor() == fTextEditor;
   above the // XXX
2. comment out rest of method
3. launch the prepared workspace
4. click on the editor tab of the not yet active editor
==> NPEs:

I have found JavaReconciler in "org.eclipse.jdt.ui", and have checked it out 
from CVS.  I have revision 1.18.  It seems to be the most recent.  Am I doing 
something wrong? 
 
Also, nothing from JDT seems to appear on the stack.  What is the listener 
called? 
 
I've seen a NullPointerException at this line before, but I can't remember the 
exact bug.  Also, see Bug 35815.  Regardless of the ultimate reason for this 
problem, we should maybe look at trying to make this line "do the right thing" 
if the pane turns out to be null. 
 
The second null pointer occurs because the site for the active editor has a 
null pane.

>Am I doing something wrong?
No, I had another (better) idea to fix the problem and hence there's no rev.
1.19 yet - sorry about that. Even though rev 1.19 is now there it no longer
shows the problem. I've attache JavaReconciler.java which directly triggers the
problem - no need to modify it. The last call in
JavaReconciler.ElementChangedListener.isActiveEditor() triggers the bug (if you
uncomment the lines above the bug goes away).

>Also, nothing from JDT seems to appear on the stack.
Yes, that's what first drove me nuts. I only had a chance to find the problem
because I knew what code I just changed. I then debugged it.

This is similar to Bug 69900.  Basically, it looks like re-entrant 
initialization.  I thought this was fixed, but I didn't write the code that 
finally went in. 
 
Stefan: Can you comment on this?

Doug, my gut feeling is the same as yours (since the patch for bug 69900 only
went into the 3.0.1 stream)...

However, I can't see the same method twice anywhere on the stack. (I'd expect to
see EditorManager$Editor.getPart(boolean) twice if this were a dupe of bug 69900).

Woops, I meant to say: "If you follow Dani's steps and set a breakpoint, you 
can watch the double init happen."
*** Bug 78451 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 35815 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The editor creation and error handling code has changed significantly, probably
making this bug stale.
I can no longer reproduce with the steps given.

This should be marked as fixed. Preventing this sort of re-entrant
initialization was one of the reasons for refactoring the workbench page and
error handling code.
